title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 LES DISPARITÉS DANS L ACCÈS

description.narrative: By 2017, the capacities of the education system are reinforced to improve the enrollment of out-of-school children, especially children with disabilities, girls living in rural areas and other vulnerable children, including during emergency situations, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children and adolescents, particularly those living in rural and poor urban areas, have access to quality education and adopt a healthy and responsible behavior towards HIV/AIDS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, the capacities of the education system are reinforced to improve the enrollment of out-of-school children, especiallychildren with disabilities, girls living in rural areas and other vulnerable children, including during emergency situations

description.narrative: UNICEF has continued its advocacy to ensure the education of the most vulnerable children most of whom remains out-of-school especially refugee children, migrant, nomad children, girls in rural areas and disable children. The education of these children has been highlighted in the new education strategic plan. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018
